hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Hammam that he heard Abu Hurayrah saying: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Let none of you curse time (al-dahr), for indeed Allah is time. Let none of you say to the grape vine 'the vine' (al-karm), for the vine is the Muslim man. And it is also reported from Ayyub from Ibn Sireen from Abu Hurayrah from the Prophet ﷺ. And it is reported from al-Zuhri from Ibn al-Musayyab from Abu Hurayrah from the Prophet ﷺ that Allah said: The son of Adam hurts me by saying 'O calamity of time!' So let none of you say 'O calamity of time!' for I am time, I rotate it, its night and its day. When I wish, I seize both of them.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ayyub from Ikrimah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Do not boast about your fathers who died in the pre-Islamic era. By Allah, the beetle that rolls dung at its nostril is better than them. The likeness of this is like a king who built a house and prepared food, and he would call people to his food. He sent a messenger upon whom were tattered clothes. They found him and were pushing him, saying to him: Get out! He said: Did you not prepare this food so that people would eat it? They said: Yes, but your like does not eat it. Only the righteous servants of the king eat from the king's food. He said: So he went out, then came back wearing fine clothes and passed by them, but did not enter. They hastened to him, or he said: They rushed toward him, calling him, and he refused to come with them. They said: If you do not come with us, the king will punish us if he is informed that you passed by here. He said: So he made his clothes drip in the food. That is their likeness.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Qatadah and Ali ibn Zayd ibn Judaan, both said: There was a matter between Saad ibn Abi Waqqas and Salman al-Farsi. Saad said while they were in a gathering: Recite your genealogy O so-and-so! So he recited, then he said to another, then to another, until he reached Salman. He said: Recite your genealogy O Salman! He said: I do not know a father for myself in Islam, but I am Salman the son of Islam. This reached Umar. Umar said to Saad and when he met him: Recite your genealogy O Saad! He said: I take Allah as witness O Commander of the Believers! It was as if he knew. He refused to let him go until he recited, then he said to another until he reached Salman. He said: Recite your genealogy O Salman! He said: Allah has blessed me with Islam, so I am Salman the son of Islam. Umar said: Quraysh knows that al-Khattab was their mightiest in the pre-Islamic era, and I am Umar the son of Islam, brother of Salman in Islam. By Allah, if it were not so, I would have punished you with a punishment that the people of the cities would hear. Did you not know, or did you not hear that a man claimed ancestry to nine fathers in the pre-Islamic era, and he was the tenth of them in the Fire, and a man claimed ancestry to a man in Islam and left what was above that, and he was with him in Paradise.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Sa'id ibn Abd al-Rahman al-Jahshi from some of his teachers: That the Messenger of Allah ﷺ went to a man from the Ansar seeking him, but did not find him. So he sat until the man came. When he saw the Prophet ﷺ, he put a rope around his waist, then climbed his palm tree and cut a cluster from it, and brought it to the Prophet ﷺ. Then he entered his sheep and took a sheep to slaughter. The Prophet ﷺ said: Avoid the nursing (ones). When he finished, the Prophet ﷺ said: When captives come to us, come to us. So captives came to the Prophet ﷺ and he distributed them among the people until only two slaves remained with him. The Ansari came and the Prophet ﷺ said: Choose whichever you wish. He said: Rather you choose for me, O Messenger of Allah! So the Prophet ﷺ stroked one of his hands over the other twice while saying: The one consulted is a trustee, the one consulted is a trustee. Take this one for the one, for I saw him praying.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Qais ibn al-Rabi': Umar's gathering was full of young and old readers (of the Quran). Sometimes he would consult them and say: Let none of you be prevented by the youth of his age from offering his opinion, for knowledge is not by youth or by age, but Allah places it where He wills. He said: Among those sitting with him was the nephew of Uyayna ibn Hisn. Uyayna came to Umar and said: By Allah, you do not speak justice, nor do you give generously. Umar was about to harm him, when the nephew of Uyayna said: O Commander of the Believers! Indeed Allah says (in Surah Al-A'raf, verse 199): Take what is given to you freely, and enjoin what is right, and turn away from the ignorant. This one is from the ignorant. So Umar left him. When Uthman became leader, Uyayna came to him and said: Indeed Umar gave us and enriched us and we feared him.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ibn Tawus from his father: Ibn Abbas was asked about the one who comes to his wife through the rear, and he said: This one is asking me about disbelief. Narrated also: Someone informed me from hearing Ikrimah narrating that Umar ibn al-Khattab struck a man for the same thing. Also from al-Zuhri, he said: I asked Ibn al-Musayyab and Abu Salamah ibn Abd al-Rahman about this and they disliked it and forbade me from it. Also from Qatadah, that Abdullah ibn Amr said: This is the lesser Lot's sin. Also from Qatadah, from Abu al-Darda, that he was asked about this, and he said: Would anyone do this except a disbeliever? Also from Laith, from Mujahid, from Abu Hurayrah that he said: Whoever does this has disbelieved.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from al-Zuhri from Kathir ibn Aflah, the freed slave of Abu Ayyub al-Ansari, from his father (Aflah): Abdullah ibn Salam used to enter to the heads of Quraysh before the Egyptians came, saying to them: Do not kill this man, meaning Uthman. They would say: By Allah, we do not intend to kill him. Aflah said: He left leaning on my hand, saying: By Allah, you will kill him. He also said to them when he was besieged: Leave this man forty nights. By Allah, if you leave him, he will die in that. They refused. Then after that he went to them after some days saying: Leave him fifteen (days). By Allah, if you leave him, he will die in that.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ayyub from Humaid ibn Hilal, he said: Ibn Salam said to them: Indeed the angels have been surrounding this city of yours since the Prophet ﷺ came to it until today. By Allah, if you kill him, they will depart and never return. By Allah, not one of you who kills him will meet Allah except without a hand. The sword of Allah has never been sheathed from you. By Allah, if you kill him, Allah will unsheathe it, then will never sheathe it from you - he either said forever or until the Day of Judgment. No prophet was ever killed except seventy thousand were killed for him. No caliph was ever killed except thirty-five thousand were killed for him before they gathered. And he mentioned that seventy thousand were killed for the blood of John the Baptist.
